resource:
We have long watched the aliens. Listened to the occasional strange digital chatter. A long frozen alien corpse sits in the deepest levels of a North facility. But the situation is changing - the chatter is common now and deep space scanners are lighting up.
The same kind of creature is in the vaults from 70 years ago. Compared to humans the Green is physically weak but mentally well developed. Eyesight is more adapted to darkness than ours. Genetics are similar; we are studying the alien DNA.
The Hornet is a fast, mobile alien assault troop. Its exoskeleton is strangely well suited to the rigors of modern battle and may be capable of briefly surviving vacuum. Genetically the Hornet shows some similarity to the Green, but has unique DNA structures as well.
The Viper is a heavy alien assault troop with significant natural armor. The Viper is a genetic blend of the main alien DNA with creatures of radically different genetics, possibly from yet another world.
The Jackal is a cyborg: robotics melded to an alien creature. The Jackal is a heavy weapons platform with integrated targeting systems. The creature - whatever it is and wherever it is from - is genetically distinct from all the other aliens.
The Prime is a greater variant of the Green, and statuary indicates a ruling class. Given the genetic splicing we see among the alien types, we must conclude that the Prime are conquering and integrating races of the galaxy...and have now come to Earth.
We have detected 3 classes of UFOs. From smallest to largest we refer to them as the Scout, Frigate, and Battleship. Note that the Battleship never actually lands; we will need to develop technology to infiltrate them.
We have retrieved an alien computer core. It is strange and adaptive, and much of its purpose is inscrutable. But by connecting it to alien components and our own sensors, we are beginning to get new information on the alien agenda.
The Scout is a small ship undoubtedly responsible for many alien abductions and sightings in the past. Why they leave crop circles as a part of their abduction/scanning missions is a mystery. They carry a small crew and easily fall to missile attack.
Alien weapons show tech classes we've designated T1, T2, and T3. Perhaps weapon tech reflects rank, status, or manufacturing capacity? The cells used to power the weapons are unstable during transport. We can take the guns, but not the clips.
The power Cell is the primary power source for alien weapons. We have researched techniques to field stabilize the alien cells so they can be returned to the base. We can also re-charge the cells at the base.
The anti matter cell is a short mega power burst for alien weapons. We can now apply the Cell techniques to field stabilize the anti matter clips and transport them. We can also re-charge the anti matter cells at the base.
The Frigate is a medium ship that carries about 12 units, suited for both crop circle missions and city attack. The frigate computer core has a much more sophisticated navigation and communication abilities than the Scout.
The Frigate core can authenticate with the Battleships. This will allow us to dock with the hovering Battleship and attack them. It is a very risky mission to attack a Battleship, but we now have the capacity.
Well named, a fully capable alien vessel with massive firepower, including a main gun for city control or base destruction. Intriguing however is that the navigation system is based on a homing technology. There must be a beacon, here on Earth!
The beacon has been located. Without the ability to effectively navigate over deep space, the alien threat will be highly compromised. This is our opportunity, but we feel confident that the beacon is very heavily guarded. Be prepared.
The versatile ASLT has been improved based on analysis of alien Ray Guns. ASLT-2 Gecko is a lighter, more accurate, and more powerful weapon than its predecessor.
The ASLT-3 Pulse Rifle is a hybrid of Terran and alien technology. It is a very effective all purpose weapon for wiping out the alien scourge.
The study of alien weapons has allowed to improve the range and punch of the Long Range rifle and upgrade to the LR-2 Marksman.
Based on alien stabilization technology, the Callahan LR-3 does high damage and is extremely accurate.
Study of the alien Storm-1 has allowed us to improve the effectiveness of our heavy weapon platform. We present the MCAN-2 Valiant.
Study of the alien Storm-3 and Jackal's targeting system has allowed us to develop a devastating yet portable weapon platform called the MCAN-3 Dauntless.
Shield Generators are based on alien field technology. They enhance armor. The SG:K protects against kinetic (mass driver) weapons.
Shield Generators are based on alien field technology. They enhance armor. The SG:I protects against incendiary weapons.
Shield Generators are based on alien field technology. They enhance armor. The SG:E protects against energy weapons.
We have improved the strength of standard combat armor, with the same weight and mobility.
Based on alien memory alloy technology, the ARM-3 is very good protection for field engagements.
"
Xenowar - How to Play
The game is turn based like a traditional board game. You take a turn, the aliens takes a turn, until one team is blasted into oblivion.
The following screens cover the basics; much more info on-line at xenowar.net
You can also access the game Settings from this help screen.
[Moving the Camera]
Left click and drag to scroll around the map.
Right click and drag to zoom and rotate.
You can drag the map with your finger, or pinch with 2 fingers to zoom. The trackball/wheel also zooms and rotates.
If you tap the orbit button (pictured) your next drag will rotate and zoom the camera. It is a quick way to adjust the view.
[Select a Unit]
You can select a unit by tapping on the tile where it stands.
The keyboard left/right arrow keys will also select units. control-left/right rotate. Pressing your 'u' key will hide the superfluous on-screen UI.
[Move a Unit]
You can tap the destination for unit (any colored ground location) and it will move there.
You can also drag a unit to move it.
If Confirm Movement is turned ON in the Settings, you need to accept or cancel the path shown. You can select a new destination before accepting.
[Moving on your turn]
When it is your turn, you may move as many units as you like. But each unit has a certain amount of Time Units (TU) per turn. One time unit allows one space of movement. The circles on the ground show the range of movement for the unit.
[Time Units (TU)]
Shooting also consumes TU. The color of the circle indicates how much time is remaining after you move to that location. Green for an aimed shot, Yellow for a fast shot, and Orange indicates no time left to shoot.
Inventory management and rotation consume no Time Units.
[UI Menu]
From top to bottom, the icons are: 1) Character portrait. Tapping this take you to the inventory and stats screen. 2) End turn. 3) Help. 4) Abort mission. The lander will take all units, but items on the ground will be lost. 5) Shoot at an arbitrary target. Follow by tapping a location on the map.
[Unit Menu]
Rotate left and rotate right rotates the currently selected unit. Left and right selects different units.
Remember you can also use the keyboard, and press the 'u' key to hide the control UI.
[Shooting UI]
Left click on your target to display shot choices, including info about the type of shot, the approximate odds of hitting, and ammo remaining. Every weapon is different!
The color block on the right is the amount of TU left after you fire.
[Reaction fire]
Reaction fire occurs when your units fire at the aliens during the alien turn. It is key to an effective defense.
For reaction fire to occur, you must have enough TU left over by ending your move in the Green or Yellow circles.
Rotation greatly impacts reaction fire. Make sure you end your turn facing where you think the aliens are hiding!
[Unit Screen]
Use this screen to pick up and drop items, wear armor, and select a weapon. You can also view statistics about the current unit.
The name of the weapon the unit is holding is displayed in the top left. Beside the name is the tech level, from 1 to 3. Higher tech levels indicate better weapons and armor. Below the name of the weapon is the rounds carried for that weapon. Some weapons use multiple types of ammo.
[Inventory]
What the unit is carrying. The top row is in use: the currently worn armor and currently carried weapon. You can tap to drop an item, or drag to organize items.
[React]
The React button toggles reaction fire for this unit. Normally a unit will automatically return fire during the alien turn, but you may turn it off with this toggle.
[Items on the Ground]
The row of tabs select Terran Weapons, Alien Weapons, Armor/Shields, and Miscellaneous items. Tap to select a group to view. Tap an item to pick it up.
The number of items available is displayed beneath the item name.
[Stats and Numbers]
The lower right buttons show unit traits, abilities, and statistics.
'Inv' is the default inventory screen. 'Stats' shows the unit statistics. 'Wpns' compares weapons carried and on the ground at 8m range.
[Xenowar]
Xenowar. Copyright 2011 Lee Thomason / Grinning Lizard Software. 'Face' renderer by Johan Forsberg.
Welcome to Xenowar! Xenowar is an alien blasting strategy game. You can submit feedback, read the community forum, or get more gameplay information at xenowar.net. The gameplay wiki is at xenowar.wikispaces.com
The buttons on the lower right navigate help, the lower left exits help.
[Overview]
Xenowar combines strategic and tactical games.
The strategic game is the geo-scape where you build bases, defend against UFOs, research, and allocate resources in real time. When ground combat occurs, the tactical game is turn based combat.
[Getting Started]
'Continue' resumes the game in progress.
'New Game' brings up the new game choices. Starting a new game will delete any game in progress. After selecting 'New Game', tap 'New Geo' to play the full game, or 'New Tactical' to play a single battle.
The game auto-saves at exit. Optionally you have 4 additional save slots that can be accessed via the 'disk' icon.
Good luck and have fun!
[Xenowar]
The geo view shows the world, its nations, and the state of the alien invasion.
The strategic part of the game is played out on this screen, in real time. When combat occurs, it is turn based on the tactical screen.
You can also access the game Settings from this help screen.
[Main UI]
The upper left button takes you to the research screen.
The lower left toggles base building. With this button down, tap on the map to build a base. Start the game by building a base. Your first base comes fully provisioned.
The lower right display shows your current cash in megadollars.
Tap and drag to scroll the display. You can tap a base or grounded UFO for additional menus.
[Regions]
There are 6 geo-political regions: North, South, Europe, Asia, Africa, and Under. Beneath the name of each region is a bar that indicates the amount of alien influence.
Each region has its own traits. Regions can be 1) capitalistic (better prices), 2) militaristic (better soldiers), 3) scientific (faster research), 4) nationalistic (resists alien takeover), 5) high tech (make tech-3 weapons), or 6) manufacturing (make tech-3 armor).
[Alien Invasion]
Aliens initially generate influence with crop circles. With more influence, the aliens will mount city attacks or even attack your bases.
When attacking, be aware that night fights are more difficult than day fights, and a normal UFO is harder to assault than a crashed one.
You win the game by destroying the alien base. You'll lose the game if the aliens occupy all the world capitals.
[Base Options]
Tapping any base brings up the base options.
Supply: Purchases and sells supplies from the host region. A base must have a 'cargo' facility to use supply.
Equip: Equip the base squad, see unit stats, and compare weapons. A base must have a 'cargo' and 'troops' facility to have units.
Build: Build base facilities.
[UFO Options]
Tapping a crashed or invading UFO brings up a list of bases that can send troops. Tap the base name to send a lander.
The lander carries troops to and from the battle. It can even retrieved unconscious units and make an escape from the field.
If the battle is successful, items gathered from the battle field will be placed in the base's storage. Items needed for research are automatically applied.
[Build Base Help]
Here you can buy base facilities. Tap on the facility, it will be built, and funds deducted from you treasury.
Troops: purchases and lander and barracks so troops can be hired for missions. Missile: long range weapons. Cargo: a cargo lander allows selling and purchasing from the host region. Guns: short range weapons. SciLab: allows the recruitment of scientists for research.
[Supply Base Help]
Tap to move items from the base storage (on the left) to the region's supply ship (on the right). The "Sell All" toggle, when on, will sell all items in a slot with a single tap.
Ammo clips refill after battle. (Which is reflected in their cost.) Tech-3 items can only be purchased from regions with the required traits.
You can hire soldiers and scientists by purchasing them in the region's Alien tab.
[Research]
This scene shows the current research project, and options for other research you can do. Research is applied over time, and is directly proportional to the number of scientists in your bases.
Beneath the name of each research task is items required to begin that task.
